subject: CHLIT

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: Completion of 2nd year of Chinese or permission of instructor; students who have a working knowledge of the Chinese script from another language (e.g., Japanese) may be able to take the course.

description: First part of a two-part introductory course. Students learn the fundamental grammar and vocabulary of Classical Chinese by analyzing and translating short passages from early sources.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: completion of 2nd year Chinese or permission of instructor.
catalogPermission: Students who have working knowledge of the Chinese script from another language (e.g. Japanese) may be able to take the course.

subject: CHLIT

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: CHIN 4412 or CHIN 2210 or graduate standing with knowledge of Chinese language.

description: This practicum-style course is intended to teach advanced students of the Chinese language to read, understand, and translate literature from modern Chinese into English. Students will read essays on translation in both English and Chinese, and then put theory into practice by producing original translations of essays, poems, or short fiction. This process will teach translation as a craft, but it is also intended for students who want to read deeply and carefully, as good translators must. Prior experience with or specialization in Chinese literature is not required. By the end of the semester, each student will produce a complete translation of a previously untranslated literary work, which will be discussed and revised by the practicum as a whole.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: CHIN 4412 or CHIN 2210 or graduate student standing with knowledge of Chinese language.

description: Second semester of a two-part introductory course. Students learn the fundamental grammar and vocabulary of Classical Chinese and gain familiarity with more advanced sources for solving textual problems by analyzing and translating passages from early sources.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: CHLIT 2213 or permission of instructor. Students who have working knowledge of the Chinese script from another language (e.g. Japanese) may be able to take the course.

subject: CHLIT

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: Completion of CHLIT 2213 and CHLIT 2214 or instructor's consent.

description: Through guided readings in Chinese of selected poems of the Tang dynasty (618-907) on various themes and in different styles, students develop the essential analytical skills for reading Tang poetry while gaining an understanding of its social, cultural, and historical contexts.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: minimum three years of Chinese and/or one year of Classical Chinese or permission of instructor.

subject: CHLIT

subject: CHLIT
titleLong: Violence, Sex, and Justice in Premodern Chinese Novel

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: Two years or more of Chinese or instructor's consent.

description: This course centers on close reading of four masterworks of Chinese novel of the sixteenth century, such as Romance of Three Kingdoms (Sanguo yanyi), Journey to the West (Xiyou ji), Water Margin (Shuihu zhuan), and The Plum in the Golden Vase (Jin Ping Mei) in their original form. By a combination of translating selective chapters and discussing secondary scholarship, the course aims to examine the novels both as literary and historical artifacts evolving with the society in which they were created and circulated.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: two years or more of Chinese or instructor's consent.

subject: CHLIT

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: CHLIT 2213-2214 or permission of instructor.

description: This course is designed to help students achieve competence in reading classical Chinese at an advanced level through selected readings in the original language. At the same time, it introduces students to different styles and themes of classical Chinese prose.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: CHLIT 2214 or permission of instructor.

subject: CHLIT
titleLong: Studies in Medieval Chinese Literature and Culture

notes.descrlong: Reading knowledge of Classical and modern Chinese is required.

description: This is a seminar designed for first- and second-year graduate students who intend to pursue advanced study in the field of medieval China studies. It introduces students to the materials and tools that are essential for conducting research in the literature and culture of the period as well as the larger issues of goals and methods. In particular, students will examine prevalent practices and trends that define the scholarship on medieval China in the past few decades; they will also consider the question concerning future directions and opportunities that may be available to scholars in the field.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: Reading knowledge of Classical and modern Chinese is required.

subject: CHLIT

notes.descrlong: Prerequisite: CHLIT 2213 & 2214 or permission of instructor.

description: A guided reading in the original language designed to introduce students to a variety of genres and styles of classical Chinese literature while at the same time helping students achieve competence in reading classical Chinese at an advanced level. The syllabus, with a rotating thematic focus, normally includes philosophical works, historical texts, poetry and prose, anecdotes and fiction. Please consult the Department of Asian Studies course offerings for each year's thematic focus.
catalogPrereqCoreq: Prerequisite: CHLIT 2213/CHLIT 2214 or permission of instructor.
